raw: * Shows any elements with "display: none" in the collection. If an element
* was hidden by using the {@link #hide} method, its previous
* "display" style value will be re-applied. Otherwise, the
* default "display" value for the element type will be applied.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Shows any elements with "display: none" in the collection. If an element was hidden by using the {@link #hide} method, its previous "display" style value will be re-applied. Otherwise, the default "display" value for the element type will be applied.

raw: * Hides all elements in the collection by setting their "display"
* style to "none". The previous value is stored so it can be re-applied

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Hides all elements in the collection by setting their "display" style to "none". The previous value is stored so it can be re-applied when {@link #show} is called.

raw: * Returns the distance between the first element in the collection and its
* @return {Map} a map with the keys left and top
* containing the distance between the elements

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the distance between the first element in the collection and its offset parent

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} a map with the keys left and top containing the distance between the elements
@return.description: a map with the keys left and top containing the distance between the elements

raw: * Returns the computed location of the given element in the context of the
* * margin: Calculate from the margin box of the element (bigger than the visual appearance: including margins of given element)
* * box: Calculates the offset box of the element (default, uses the same size as visible)
* * border: Calculate the border box (useful to align to border edges of two elements).
* * scroll: Calculate the scroll box (relevant for absolute positioned content).
* * padding: Calculate the padding box (relevant for static/relative positioned content).
* @param mode {String?box} A supported option. See comment above.
* of the element relative to the document.

@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Returns the computed location of the given element in the context of the document dimensions. Supported modes:

  • margin: Calculate from the margin box of the element (bigger than the visual appearance: including margins of given element)
  • box: Calculates the offset box of the element (default, uses the same size as visible)
  • border: Calculate the border box (useful to align to border edges of two elements).
  • scroll: Calculate the scroll box (relevant for absolute positioned content).
  • padding: Calculate the padding box (relevant for static/relative positioned content).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: mode {String?box} A supported option. See comment above.
@param.description: A supported option. See comment above.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Map} A map with the keys left, top, right and bottom which contains the distance of the element relative to the document.
@return.description: A map with the keys left, top, right and bottom which contains the distance of the element relative to the document.
